title: What if there were a war between humans and robots today? - Quora

response.answer_text: It would be a complete non starter. While “artificial intelligence” is evolving at a rapid pace, it’s still not really any kind of real intelligence. If you were to compare artificial life’s evolution path to biological lives evolution path, artificial life is still at the primordial soup state, it hasn’t even managed to form a single celled life form yet. All “robots” or “AI” systems require constant human super vision. No matter how complicated, or advanced any system on earth is today, there’s always a few human required to set up machines, maintain them, replace cutters, etc.. biological machines don’t need that kind of supervision. At this point in time, for a machine to even consider going to war with humans, someone would have to specifically create a machine with that as it’s goal. If we ever do create an artificial intelligence, there’s no reason to think it would go to war with humans. It has no incentive too. If it doesn’t like humans and living things in general it would be much easier for it to create a space faring body for itself and just leave earth. Humans like to see themselves as detached from the rest of the natural world, as if we are somehow above it. The AI might not see it that way, it may just see us as one of the animals of this ecosystem, and may see it as wrong for it to interfere with the natural order of things. If it did want to change things and was somehow able to control the machines of production. It could just as easily stop those means of production, come up with better products and force humans to change just by controlling food production, our dependence on global trade makes us very vulnerable that way. At the moment people don’t go hungry because there isn’t enough food in the world, they go hungry because they can’t afford the food. People aren’t homeless because there aren’t enough homes. They just can't afford the cost of living in a home. So any AI could probably rearrange things pretty quickly to make life much better, for more people. It might not need to use war.

Humans win, hands down. Robots (today) don’t have any real intelligence in them. They’re either: 1) designed to perform a specific task over and over again. We’d be pretty stupid to program them to “kill all humans”. Even if we did, they lack creativity or free will, so they’d be pretty easy to beat after a round or two. or 2) Designed to be directed by humans and possessing limited autonomy. Any intelligence is to allow them to follow-through in the event of a loss or disruption of control. Without instructions or a human to initially designate targets, there isn’t much to fight. If we ever did develop or facilitate an actual machine intelligence, we’d have to be absolute idiots to enslave it in a weapons system. It would make about as much sense as making breast implants out of C-4. Zero benefit and a pointless and ridiculously high risk.
